instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..

threads.title: 2013-2019 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> graphical glitching  RESEARCH TOPIC
threads.message:
I have seen several of these machines that exhibit graphical glitches (typically green) while playing full screen video. The machine will otherwise behave normally with no other issues. I suspect this is either one of 2 things. 

A. Driver issue related to a specific MacOs version 

OR. 

B. Dying Intel iGPU or a driver issue with a specific revision of the intel iGPU. 

If you have seen one of these machines, or have one of these machines in your shop, could you please post the MacOs version number as well as the info under System Report - Graphics and Displays? 

Thanks! Also curious to what others think of this. It has been bugging me lately.

threads.title: 2013-2019 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> graphical glitching  RESEARCH TOPIC
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> are 2 totally different platforms so I doubt it will be hardware related.

I think the Netflix bug with flickering video is still present when running in Safari, so maybe it is that?

threads.title: 2013-2019 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> graphical glitching  RESEARCH TOPIC
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 58277"]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> are 2 totally different platforms so I doubt it will be hardware related.

I think the Netflix bug with flickering video is still present when running in Safari, so maybe it is that?[/QUOTE]

That is a possibility, I will check with people and see if it is a netflix and safari issue alone. 

I have heard of this same issue on both 1466 and 1932, so I just wanted to see if maybe, both machines were running the same MacOs version #.
